title.rendered: Offshore Wind Consultants to support Iberdrola wind farm projects

content.rendered:
13 February 2017 – Offshore Wind Consultants Limited, part of Oslo-listed Aqualis ASA, has been awarded a framework agreement by Iberdrola to provide engineering and project management services for various wind farm projects offshore East Anglia, UK.

Under the agreement, Offshore Wind Consultants Limited (OWC) will provide engineering consultancy services for the East Anglia ONE, East Anglia ONE North and East Anglia THREE offshore wind farm projects, as well as project management services for East Anglia One.

“OWC is already providing geotechnical ancillary services on the East Anglia One project. We therefore have a solid understanding of the project. To be trusted with additional work is testament to the benefits of the excellent working relationship that the OWC team has built with this important client and we are looking forward to supporting Iberdrola on these future wind farm projects,” says Ian Bonnon, managing director of OWC.

OWC’s project management scope for East Anglia ONE includes project management, construction readiness assessment, specialist consultancy, production of technical reports and drafting of construction procedures and other key documents. Under the terms of the new agreement there is also the potential to add additional support services through the life cycle of the project.

Offshore Wind Consultants is a globally focused consultancy providing independent services to the offshore renewables industry.

 

ENDS

 

For further information, please contact:

Media
Endre Aaberg Johansen, Corporate Communications AS, tel: +47 41 61 06 05, email: endre.johansen@corpcom.no.

 

Investors
Kim Boman, CFO, Aqualis ASA, tel: +47 959 63 912, email: kim.boman@aqualis.no

 

About Aqualis ASA
Aqualis ASA (OSE: Aqua) is a public company that, through its subsidiaries and associates, offers energy consultancy services to the oil and gas, wind and solar sectors globally. The group employs experienced consultants across 22 offices in 15 countries worldwide. Aqualis ASA operates under three different brands: AqualisBraemar, Offshore Wind Consultants and ADLER Solar. AqualisBraemar is a specialised offshore marine and engineering consultancy firm, focusing on the shallow and deep-water offshore segments of the oil and gas industry. Offshore Wind Consultants is a globally focused consultancy providing independent services to the offshore renewables industry. ADLER Solar is a full-service provider for the PV industry. It offers technical solutions and services for the entire life cycle of photovoltaic plants. Aqualis owns 49.9 percent of ADLER Solar.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC congratulates ScottishPower Renewables and the East Anglia ONE team
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC’s involvement with ScottishPower Renewables’ East Anglia ONE project dates back to 2013, and the global consultant is still involved today as the 714 MW offshore wind farm completes the final commissioning with all her 102 Siemens Gamesa 7 MW turbines now operational. OWC started by developing the ground model…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC awarded Mayflower Wind framework agreement
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Mayflower Wind, the 50/50 joint venture between Shell and EDP Renewables, has awarded a framework agreement to offshore wind consultancy firm OWC for provision of engineering support to the US wind farm development.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC establishes office in Poland
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC continues its international expansion and sets up an office in Poland to support offshore wind developments in the Baltic Sea. Lukasz Sikorski has been appointed manager of the office.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC reaches 50 GW milestone
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Following recent project awards in Taiwan, the US and the UK, OWC has reached the impressive milestone of being involved in more than 50 GW of offshore wind projects since the company’s inception in 2011.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC tasked with floating wind technology review
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC closely follows the development of around 40 technology solutions for floating wind platforms. Under this contract, OWC will assess the technology readiness level of each.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC successfully completes the supervision & management of the onshore & overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Offshore Wind Consultants Ltd (OWC), part of the AqualisBraemar group, has successfully completed the supervision and management of the onshore and overwater cable route site investigation for the East Anglia ONE offshore windfarm off the east coast of the UK. This was a high profile and complex investigation using a…
